heading: Multi-platform Support
description: Interactive, visually compelling content on desktop, mobile and beyond, all reached with a single codebase to deliver transferable experiences.

heading: Advanced Text Rendering
description: Beautiful anti-aliased text at native and retina resolutions means that Pixi copy is as easy on the eye as it is on any other delivery method.

heading: Tinting & Blending Modes
description: Designers and clients will be thrilled by Photoshop quality blending and colour modes.

heading: Full Scene Graph
description: Organise your objects in hierarchical trees, with parent-child relationships.

heading: Sprite Sheet Support
description: PixiJS caters for a range of sprite sheet formats and includes advanced support for features like trimming and rotational packing.

heading: Renderer Auto-detect
description: Certain, older platforms may not be able to use WebGL. Not a problem with PixiJS as Canvas fallback is seamless and automated.

heading: Asset Loader
description: Sprite-sheets, graphics, fonts, animation data (soon to have Adobe Animate support). All your incoming assets can be loaded and handled by PixiJS.

heading: Deploy into Apps
description: Use technologies such as Cordova to rapidly deploy your Pixi project as an App. Superb for both concepting and full delivery.

heading: Easy API
description: Designed to be intuitive and easy to pick up. Developers old and new will find themselves right at home with its simple yet powerful API.

heading: Accessibility
description: PixiJS is an inclusive technology and all content can be made to be screen reader accessible with ease. The only WebGL renderer out there that does.

heading: WebGL Filters
description: Use and create your own spectacular WebGL filters and shaders to give your projects next-level visual fidelity and performance.

heading: Multi-touch Interactivity
description: True multi-touch input and tracking means that you can create interactions such as pinch-to-scale that give audiences native feeling experiences.
